quizzes.question: Which of the following is not a supported parameter of the transition property?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]CSS3 Transitions[/h1]

CSS3 transitions allow us to change from one property value to another over a given duration. 
[b]transition-property[/b] - specifies the property to be transitioned
[b]transition-duration[/b] - specifies the duration over which transitions should occur
[b]transition-timing-function[/b] - specifies how the pace of the transition changes over its duration
[b]transition-delay[/b] - specifies a delay (in seconds) for the transition effect

In the example below, we set the transition property to [b]transform[/b], with a [b]duration [/b]of 5 seconds, and with an [b]ease-in[/b] timing function that specifies a transition effect with a slow start. [code format="css"]transition: transform 5s ease-in;[/code]
[note]Transition effects can be applied to a wide variety of CSS properties, including [b]background-color[/b], [b]width[/b], [b]height[/b], [b]opacity[/b], and many more. [/note]

quizzes.question: Which of the following timing functions defines custom transitions?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]transition-timing-function[/h1]

The [b]transition-timing-function[/b] property specifies the speed curve of the transition effect.
It can have the following values:
[b]ease [/b]- the animation starts slowly, then accelerates quickly.
[b]ease-in[/b] - starts slowly, then accelerates, and stops abruptly.
[b]ease-out[/b] - starts quickly, but decelerates to a stop.
[b]ease-in-out[/b] - similar to ease, but with more subtle acceleration and deceleration.
[b]linear [/b]- constant speed throughout the animation; often best for color or opacity changes.

Finally, we have [b]cubic-bezier(), [/b]which allows you to define [b]your own values in the cubic-bezier function[/b]. Possible values are numeric values from 0 to 1. [code format="css" codeId="621"]transition-timing-function: [b]cubic-bezier(0,0,1,1)[/b];[/code]
[note]If no timing function is specified, the [b]default[/b] value is [b]ease[/b].[/note]
